intro: Euphrasia cadevallii, commonly known as the Cadevall's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant features small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance. Euphrasia cadevallii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
